column4: Hello! I installed Ubuntu on my laptop, and now I cant get Windows to boot with Grub. Windows is _not_ on the first partition as some say it should be. Is it possible to do it anyways?
check your 'sudo fdisk -l' layout  - it may be on the 2nd partition.
on a gateway laptop ive seen. first partition is a recovery tool. 2nd is actual windows. We put linux on 3rd+
edit the grub menu.lst file then to have a proper entry. actually the installer normally puts an entry in for every windows type partition it sees.
I installed windows long time ago, when I had linux installed, which means that it was put "at the end" of the hdd
Interesting.. Ive found that a good learning of the ins and outs of grub. is well worth the effort. :)
there was none.. is there some command to make it probe?
i know of no command that 'rescans' the whole system like the installer does.
teres an examaple entry for windows on hda1, you can uncomment it and change what drive it looks for easially however.
say I have win xp installed on fourth partition, could you be so kind to pm me what you think it should look like?
4th partition of hda? if so it will be like hd0,3
should I use root or rootnoverify?
for wimndows partitions you alwyas use rootnoverify i belive
I also have makeactive and chainloader +1, is there something I forgot?
No idea. Ijust uncomment that example for my system.  and it works.  theres like 4 lines you uncomment.
I get Error 13: Invalid or unsupported executable format..
i would have to say check the grub docs/guides.   proberly a typo/error somewhere.
